text: Oresteia is a Greek opera by Iannis Xenakis made in 1965 and 1966. The work is based on Oresteia by Aeschylus. It is made for a chorus and twelve instrument players and is 50 minutes. Xenakis made two additional parts of the music in the 1980s and 1992. == Development == Most of the opera was finished in 1966. It was made for an event in Ypsilanti, Michigan. In the 1980s, Xenakis made a cantata for an additional part, named Kassandra. In 1992, Xenakis would make his last part, La Déesse Athéna (the goddess Athena). == Music and instrumentation == The opera is made for a children's chorus and twelve instrumentalists. == References == Category:Greek mythology
title: Oresteia (Xenakis)
